meanings.definition: The sloping bank of a river or lake.
meanings.sent1: The children played by the braes, enjoying the gentle slope.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen set up their gear by the braes to catch some fish.
meanings.sent3: The picnic by the braes turned into a fun adventure when the sandwiches rolled down the slope.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the braes, casting long shadows over the water.
meanings.sent5: The ducks waddled down to the braes, quacking happily by the water's edge.

meanings.sent1: The sheep grazed peacefully on the braes, enjoying the lush grass.
meanings.sent2: The hikers climbed the braes, enjoying the view from the top.
meanings.sent3: The children rolled down the braes, laughing all the way to the bottom.
meanings.sent4: The braes were covered in a blanket of snow, glistening in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed brightly on the braes, adding color to the landscape.
